qas.question: Who has authority of school systems in Switzerland?
What is the minimum age for primary school in all cantons?
What do most cantons provide for free when children are 4 or 5 years old?
When was English introduced as a first foreign language in many cantons?
How long does primary school continue?

answers.text: until grade four, five or six

context: Education in Switzerland is very diverse because the constitution of Switzerland delegates the authority for the school system to <a0_0>the cantons<a0_0/>. There are both public and private schools, including many private international schools. The minimum age for primary school is about <a1_0>six<a1_0/> years in all cantons, but most cantons provide a free "<a2_0>children's school<a2_0/>" starting at four or five years old. Primary school continues <a4_0>until grade four, five or six<a4_0/>, depending on the school. Traditionally, the first foreign language in school was always one of the other national languages, although recently (<a3_0>2000<a3_0/>) English was introduced first in a few cantons.
